About

Syed Bokhari

LinkedIn profile

I am a Core-level Behaviour Support Practitioner (under supervision) working with NDIS participants, families, and provider teams to support the development and implementation of Positive Behaviour Support strategies. My application to the NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission has been submitted.

Professional background

I currently work as a Senior Complex Support Needs Planner with the National Disability Insurance Agency (NDIA), where I support participants with complex psychosocial, behavioural, and functional needs. This role involves comprehensive assessment, identification of behaviour-related risks, and collaboration with participants, families, guardians, and providers to develop person-centred supports consistent with NDIS legislation and policy.

Through this work, I have developed strong experience in safeguarding considerations, least-restrictive practice, multidisciplinary collaboration, and high-quality professional documentation. I work closely with specialist providers, including Behaviour Support Practitioners, and contribute to risk-informed and ethically grounded decision-making.

Behaviour support practice

Within my current scope as a Core Behaviour Support Practitioner, I contribute to behaviour support work under supervision, including participation in functional assessment processes, Behaviour Support Plan (BSP) development, and implementation support. All behaviour support work is reviewed and co-signed by a Proficient or Advanced Behaviour Support Practitioner, in line with the NDIS Capability Framework.

  • Positive Behaviour Support (PBS) principles
  • Functional behaviour assessment (under supervision)
  • Behaviour-related risk identification and safety considerations
  • Support implementation, coaching, and consistency planning
  • Reflective practice and structured supervision

Qualifications and training

  • Bachelor of Biomedicine
  • Master of Arts
  • Completion of NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission–recommended Behaviour Support Practitioner modules
  • Ongoing professional development aligned with the BSP Capability Framework

Practice approach

  • Person-centred and trauma-informed practice
  • Respect for dignity, rights, and choice
  • Ethical and reflective decision-making
  • Clear documentation and measurable outcomes
  • Collaboration with families, providers, and multidisciplinary teams

Registration and compliance

I practise within a clearly defined Core BSP scope and am committed to transparency, ethical practice, and alignment with NDIS Quality and Safeguards requirements. Registration status is stated clearly on this website and can be confirmed with providers as required.

Registration status: Behaviour Support Practitioner application submitted and pending. All behaviour support work is undertaken under supervision and in accordance with applicable NDIS standards and governance arrangements.
NDIS Behaviour Support Practitioner
Behaviour Support Practitioner application submitted and pending. Services provided consistent with applicable NDIS requirements.
